stories.text:
I have been running imagetoexcel.com registered with Google Domain. The service is live since May 2019 with 1000 DAUs. I have auto-renewal turned on, so every year it renews for one year charging my credit card linked in the account. I lost my cards in February, so I had to block my cards with the bank. Apparently, in May, Google Services tried to take the payment and hit a bad response from the Payment. I received an email stating the same, so when I tried to add a new card(s) it threw an error `OR-CCSEH-21`. Understandably they had to verify me and asked me to submit my ID, which I did. Two weeks to date no response from the Google Pay services, even on the follow-up. Now the site is down.

As a precautionary step, I've transferred my 4 other domains to the porkbun, which was super easy. I just thought of informing fellow hacker news followers to keep them out in such a situation.
stories.title: Tell HN: Transfer your Google domain to other registrar before it locks you out
LatchBio just raised a $28M Series A to build the AWS x GitHub for biocomputing

stories.text:
Hey! I would like to build an online coaching network, where mentors and mentees can find each other and connect.

There are tons to validate at this stage so I am wondering what kind of tools do you know about that can help.

buddyboss.com was suggested at one point and potentially we might start with it, any suggestions/recommendations?

bubble.io is also an option, but like a lower level comparing to buddyboss.com

anyway, thanks a lot!
stories.title: Ask HN: Recommend tools to build a coaching network

stories.text:
TLDR: Reddit but competitive

I made PopResolve after experiencing the positive and fun side of fan wars, where two communities pretend to be against each other and the end result is, well... culture.

The website lets you create or join a team and go to war or become allies with other teams. Every team votes for a president who takes control over the team's resources, functions and gets to decide which teams are enemies and which are allies. Regular elections for presidents are triggered by the point system.

Future development may be aimed towards expanding the governmental structure of the teams.

More details on how it works: https://popresolve.com/support

No real world politics are allowed, we have enough of that everywhere else.
